The average number of days it takes to prepare an Approved Pre Owned vehicle for sale.
The average cost to prepare an Approved Pre Owned vehicle for sale.
The average days in stock until displayed online.
The total Gross Profit of the department less ‘cost of sale’ items.
The number of units sold in a specific period.
ROI. The profit made over and above the money spent.

body: ROI is a very useful KPI and the most important. It can be summed up easily by looking at these 2 examples.
title: P4 Text1

_items.body:
EXAMPLE 1

You buy a car for 20,000. You sell it for 20,000 (same Price)


Return on Investment = 0%

EXAMPLE 2

You buy a car for 20,000. You sell it for 30,000


Return on Investment = 50%

body:
ROI measures what you got back above what you spent!


Let's look at 2 examples and see if you can select the right answers!
title: P4 Text1

body:
Question 1


You buy a car for 20,000. You sell it for 25,000


Return on Investment = ?

_feedback.correct: Well done, 25% is correct. Because 5,000 (Return) is 25% of 20,000 (Investment).

_partlyCorrect.final: Sorry, wrong answer. 25% is correct. Because 5,000 (Return) is 25% of 20,000 (Investment).

_incorrect.final: Sorry, wrong answer. 25% is correct. Because 5,000 (Return) is 25% of 20,000 (Investment).

title: P4 MCQ 1

body:
Question 2


You buy a car for 35,000. You sell it for 37,500


Return on Investment = ?

_feedback.correct: Well done, 7.1% is correct. Because 2,500 (Return) is 7.1% of 37,500 (Investment).

_partlyCorrect.final: Sorry, wrong answer. 7.1% is correct. Because 2,500 (Return) is 7.1% of 37,500 (Investment).

_incorrect.final: Sorry, wrong answer. 7.1% is correct. Because 2,500 (Return) is 7.1% of 37,500 (Investment).

title: P4 MCQ 2

graphicText: INTRODUCTION TO THE JLR APPROVED PROGRAMME
title: Page 1 Graphic

body:
ROI is the ultimate KPI because not only does it measure what you gained against what you spent it can also indicate the speed at which you made it.


For example you could look at ROI on Used Vehicle Sales over a year, a month, per day  or even individually per day.


In our last question, buying a car for 35,000 and selling it for 37,500 gave us a ROI of 7.1%. If it took 5 days to sell, then we made 1.4% per day (500).
instruction: Next, we will see how this works in the Retailer.
title: Page 1 Text 1

_items.title: A: Car sold for 12,000. You bought it for 10,500. So, the return is 1500.
B: Car sold for 14,000. You bought it for 13,000. So, the return is 1000.

_items.body: CONCLUSION

Most people would prefer transaction ‘A’ Because it makes 500 more for a smaller outlay.


What if we added the amount of time it took to sell, would that change your mind?


A sold after 60 days.


B sold after 20 days.

That makes a big difference, in the same period of 60 days ‘B’ could have sold 3 times, then the return would be 3000


Transaction ‘A’ made 25 per day, Transaction ‘B’ made 50 per day. 


So Transaction ‘B’ is the better  by 25 per day!


Transaction ‘A’ made a daily ROI of 0.2%


Transaction ‘B’ made a daily ROI of 3.8%


‘B’ is 3.6% better Daily ROI

body:
What this proves is whilst Profit Per Unit is Important, Speed of Sale is far more important to make Profit!


How many of you measure your performance this way?


Have a look at some of your completed transactions, see if this makes a difference.
instruction: Select image to find out more
title: Page 3 Title

_items.text:
So speed is the main key to making profit!


How do we increase the speed of Sales?

One way is to sell more Approved cars, traditionally they sell a lot quicker than non-Approved vehicles.


What are the other ways?

instruction: Select all the actions that you think influences Speed of Sale

_feedback.correct: Well done, displaying or offering vehicle that have not been through the workshop is bad practice. If they are unroadworthy then in many countries, you are breaking the law!

_partlyCorrect.final: Almost correct, if you wanted to display before it has been through the workshop you should know that displaying before hand is problematic. If they are unroadworthy then in many countries, you are breaking the law!

_incorrect.final: Sorry that’s wrong, if you wanted to display before it has been through the workshop you should know that displaying before hand is problematic. If they are unroadworthy then in many countries, you are breaking the law!

_items.text: Stocking the right stock for your market
Setting the right price for your market
Putting vehicles up for sale before arrival
Effective advertising, in the right places
Put vehicle on display before reconditioning
Accurate Appraisals so the workshop is pre-booked

title: MCQ Title

body: There is a fine balance between speed and profit, as we have seen, often the speed of sale beats profit.
title: Text Title

body:
In the below example, this Retailer can reduce PPU by 174 and still retain the same ROI if they improve a Stock Turn of 8 to 9. They also sell 112 more units!


Of course it is better not to reduce PPU and improve your stock turn, in the example below they would have improved ROI by 7% (130,000) if they didn’t reduce PPU.
title: Text Title

body:
Try it for yourself. Just place your present performance Data in the 4 fields below and then enter your desired Profit Per Unit and Stock Age at the end.


Calculation is then automatic. See what difference it makes to the overall performance figures.
title: Text Title

title: iFrame Title

body: We now know that speed of sale will have the greatest influence on ROI, but we shouldn't forget the other 3 influencers!
instruction: Here are the key drivers, select each one to find out more.
title: Page 10 Text

_items.text: The amount of units we can sell per annum.
Profit per unit, we need to keep an eye on this, but remember the daily ROI. Quick profit is ideal.
Stock value, not just individually but total stock holding. Making sure we are not overstocked.

body: Reducing the stock holding will give a better ROI as long as you are not losing sales. The key is stocking the right amount of vehicles and stocking ones that sell quickly and profitably.
title: Text Title

body:
Use this simple calculator to decide on your stock units holding.


Enter your current unit sales per annum and then the stock turn you want to achieve.


It is generally accepted that your stock turn should not be below 8. Which is an average sale time of 45 days.
title: Text Title

_source: <iframe src="https://api.ucalc.pro/api/254194" sandbox="allow-same-origin allow-forms allow-scripts allow-top-navigation allow-popups-to-escape-sandbox allow-popups" scrolling="no" style="width: 100%; height: 100%; border: 0; outline: none;"></iframe>
title: iFrame Title

body:
Having the right stock for your Marketplace is a key component of improving ROI.


Having the right stock will improve profitability and speed of sale.


However, it is easier said than done! 


What is the right stock?
title: Text Title

body:
We already know how many units we need, what we need to decide is the Stock Profile.


The first place to start is by looking back at what you previously sold. Consider these 3 elements.

_items.backText: What type of product gave the biggest ROI per day?
What type of product sell best in your Sales Area?
If you need to stock 80 units, what % of that should be allocated to a type of product?

title: Page 2 Flip Card

displayTitle: EXTRA CONTRIBUTION TO THE AFTERSALES DEPARTMENT
title: Text Title

_items.body:
Earlier, we looked at how speed can improve ROI in the sales department, but it also has a positive effect on the Aftersales Department. 


In the example where we improved stock turn from 8 to 9, it resulted in 112 additional sales over the year.


This means that the Aftersales Department will recondition another 112 vehicles per year.

If the average reconditioning labour cost is 700 and traditionally workshops operated at 80% profit on labour that means for each reconditioning 560 gross profit is made. Multiply that by 112 and you have 62,720 gross profit going into the Aftersales Department. Not forgetting the profit generated in the Parts Department!


This means that the Aftersales Department has a vested interest in helping you to speed sales up!

body: So how does the Aftersales Department help you to speed up the rate of sale?
title: Text Title

displayTitle: DECIDING WHAT YOU WANT FROM THE AFTERSALES DEPARTMENT
body:
The Aftersales Department can help you by working on reconditioning the vehicle the day after it arrives in stock.


But we must help them to do this by providing them with accurate appraisals. 


There is Part Exchange Appraisal eLearning now available from Jaguar Land Rover for your Sales Executives. Reference - ED2601406- The Professional Approved Vehicle Appraisal eLearning.


You will need to develop a process that ensures an accurate Appraisal reaches the Aftersales Department so they can pre-book reconditioning.


It’s an idea to meet with the Aftersales or Service manager and share this information, particularly the increase in gross profit.


And using the process on the next page agree some standards.
title: Text Title

body: Map the path of the appraisal form through to the workshop.

body: How should our competitor Brands be displayed?

_partlyCorrect.final: Sorry, the correct answer is B: Never be positioned prominently

title: Page 13 Q1

body: The exterior totems should be located:

_items.text: A: Beside the main vehicle access to the site, parallel to the public road and set back sufficiently to maintain good visibility
B: Alongside and perpendicular to the back wheel of a vehicle on the driver’s side
C: At the entrance to the Approved display, where it is clearly visible to the Customer
D: At the entrance to the exterior Approved vehicle display
